required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: First in Human Study of M6223 in Participants With Metastatic or Locally Advanced Solid Unresectable Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Phase I, First-in-Human, Open-Label, Multiple Ascending Dose Study to Investigate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, Pharmacodynamics and Clinical Activity of M6223, an Inhibitor of TIGIT, as Single Agent and in Combination With Bintrafusp Alfa, Anti-PDL1/ TGFß Trap in, Participants With Metastatic or Locally Advanced Solid Unresectable Tumors

lead_sponsor.agency: EMD Serono Research & Development Institute, Inc.

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to determine the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics (PK), immunogenicity and (if observed) the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of M6223 as a single agent (Part 1A) and of M6223 combined with bintrafusp alfa (Part 1B) in participants with metastatic or locally advanced solid unresectable tumors.

primary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Occurrence of Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs) During the DLT Observation Period (28 Days)

Part IA and IB: Occurrence of Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Treatment Related Adverse Events (TRAEs) According to the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria of Adverse Events (NCI-CTCAE) version 5
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Part IA and IB: Number of Participants with Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) as per Severity and Deaths
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Part IA and IB: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Clinical Laboratory Measures
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Part IA and IB: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Electrocardiogram Findings
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Part IA and IB: Number of Participants with Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Vital Signs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

primary_outcome.measure: Part IA and IB: Change From Baseline in Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status
primary_outcome.time_frame: Time from randomization to final assessment at end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of approximately 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Area Under the Serum Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Sampling Time (AUC 0-t) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Area Under the Serum Concentration-Time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC 0-inf) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Area Under Serum Concentration-Time Curve Over a Dosing Interval From Time Zero to Tau (τ) (AUCτ) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmax) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Serum Concentration Observed Immediately Before Next Dosing (Ctrough) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Time to Reach Maximum Serum Concentration (Tmax) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Apparent Terminal Half-Life (t1/2) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and Part 1B: Elimination Rate Constant (Lambda z) of M6223
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1, 2, and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1B: Maximum Observed Serum Concentration (Cmax) of Bintrafusp alfa
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1 and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1B: Serum Concentration Observed Immediately Before Next Dosing (Ctrough) of Bintrafusp alfa
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose up to 14 days post-dose of Cycles 1 and 4 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part IA and 1B: Immunogenicity of M6223 Measured by Antidrug Antibody (ADA) Assays
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose of Day 1 Cycle 1 (Cycle is 14 days) up to end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1B: Immunogenicity of Bintrafusp alfa Measured by Antidrug Antibody (ADA) Assays
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose of Day 1 Cycle 1 (Cycle is 14 days) up to end of safety follow-up visit (up to a maximum of 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Change from Baseline in QT Interval
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Day 1 Cycle 1 (Baseline) up to Day 1 Cycle 7 (Each cycle is of 14 days)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and IB: Best Overall Response According to Response Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) Assessed as per Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Duration of Response According to Response Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) Assessed as per Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Time to Tumor Response According to Response Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) Assessed as per Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Disease Control According to Response Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) Assessed as per Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)

secondary_outcome.measure: Part 1A and 1B: Progression-free Survival Time According to Response Criteria in Solid Tumors Version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) Assessed as per Investigator
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)
From first study drug administration until documented disease progression or death due to any cause whichever occurs first, (approximately assessed up to 2 years)

intervention.description: Participants will receive an intravenous (IV) infusion of M6223 at escalated doses every 2 weeks on Day 1 of each Cycle (Each cycle is of 14 days) according to the recommendation of the SMC (Safety Monitoring Committee) until the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) has been reached or confirmed disease progression.
Participants will receive an IV infusion of bintrafusp alfa every 2 weeks on Day 1 of each Cycle (Cycle is 14 days) until confirmed disease progression.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants have histologically or cytologically proven locally advanced or advanced solid malignancies who are refractory to or have progressed under standard treatment and have no other treatment options known to confer clinical benefit
- Participants with Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status (ECOG PS) of 0 to 1 at Screening
- Participant has a formalin-fixed paraffin-embedded block containing tumor tissue or a minimum of 15 (preferably 25) unstained tumor slides suitable for immunohistochemistry-based staining of protein expression
- Participants with life expectancy of at least 12 weeks
- Participants with measurable disease according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1)
- Adequate hematological, hepatic and renal function as defined in the protocol
- Other protocol defined inclusion criteria may apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participants with persisting toxicity related to prior therapy Grade greater than (>) 1 National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI-CTCAE) Version 5.0, however, alopecia, sensory neuropathy Grade less than or equal to (<=) 2, or other non-immune-related Grade <= 2 not constituting a safety risk
- Participants with prior organ transplantation including allogeneic stem cell transplantation
- Participants with prior toxicity related to an immune checkpoint inhibitor Grade greater than equal to (>=) 3 NCI-CTCAE Version 5.0 unless resolved to Grade <= 1 prior to study inclusion
- Participants with current significant cardiac conduction abnormalities, including corrected QT interval (QTcF, corrected with Fridericia formula) prolongation of > 450 milli seconds (ms) or impaired cardiovascular function, ventricular tachycardia, hypokalemia or a history of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, serious cardiac arrhythmia and family history of sudden death or long QT syndrome
- A history of vascular, cardiovascular or cerebrovascular disease like, cerebral vascular accident/stroke (less than [<] 6 months prior to enrollment), myocardial infarction (< 6 months prior to enrollment), unstable angina, congestive heart failure (New York Heart Association Classification Class >= II), deep vein thrombosis (< 3 months prior to enrollment) or pulmonary thrombosis/embolism (< 3 months prior to enrollment)
- Other protocol defined exclusion criteria may apply

overall_official.affiliation: Merck Healthcare KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany, an affiliate of Merck KGaA, Darmstadt, Germany

link.description: US Medical Information website, Medical Resources

patient_data.ipd_description: Per company policy, following approval of a new product or a new indication for an approved product in both the EU and the US, EMD Serono will share study protocols, anonymized patient level and study level data and redacted clinical study reports from clinical trials in patients with qualified scientific and medical researchers, upon request, as necessary for conducting legitimate research. Further information on how to request data can be is found on our website https://www.emdgroup.com/en/research/our-approach-to-research-and-development/healthcare/clinical-trials/commitment-responsible-data-sharing.html
